newsitem.title: NORWAY: Oil output shut in at N. Sea Statfjord A, Snorre.
newsitem.headline: Oil output shut in at N. Sea Statfjord A, Snorre.

text.p: Oil production at the North Sea Statfjord A and Snorre platforms was shut in on Wednesday due to burgeoning storage and disruptions to crude loadings due to bad weather, operator Den norske stats oljeselskap AS (Statoil) said.
Statoil also cut production at the Statfjord B and C installations and expected to reduce output at the Gullfaks development at 0100 GMT on Thursday.
Weather forecasts indicated loading operations would not begin until late Friday or Saturday, a Statoil spokesman said.
Pumping was halted at Statfjord A at midnight on Tuesday. Snorre, which feeds crude to Statfjord A for processing and loading, was closed at the same time.
Throughput at Statfjord B was reduced to 25 percent late on Tuesday and Statfjord was running 10 percent below normal capacity, Statoil said.

Statfjord pumps about 380,000 barrels per day (bpd) and processes oil from the Statfjord East and North satellites and the nearby Snorre development, which add roughly 370,000 bpd to the Statfjord stream.
